etymologies: late Middle English: from French dent-de-lion, translation of medieval Latin dens leonis ‘lion's tooth’ (because of the jagged shape of the leaves)

definitions: a widely distributed weed of the daisy family, with a rosette of leaves, bright yellow flowers followed by globular heads of seeds with downy tufts, and stems containing a milky latex.

notes.text: Genus Taraxacum, family Compositae: several species, in particular the common T. officinale, which has edible leaves

shortDefinitions: widely distributed weed of daisy family, with rosette of leaves
